Name: Mike Ounsworth
AboutMe:
I am currently working as a C++ and Java developer in the encryption and public-key infrastructure domain.

Previously, I was a master's student at McGill University's School of Computer Science. I studied robotics, specifically computer vision and path planning.

While at McGill, I held a Tomlinson Teaching Fellowship, the main focus of which was to train graduate teaching assistants in the use of Active Learning Strategies in the classroom.

I have been involved in the FIRST Robotics competition since 2004 as a student and a mentor, which has massively shaped my life.
